title: Building Fish Basket Traps
brief: Construct funnel-shaped fish traps using sticks and vines for passive fish catching.
steps: Step 1: Collect several straight sticks of similar length and flexible vines for lashing.
Step 2: Lash sticks together with vines to form a funnel shape with the wide opening for fish entry.
Step 3: Close the narrow top of the funnel, leaving a hole just large enough for target fish to swim through.
Step 4: Ensure the funnel narrows consistently from opening to the small entry hole.
Step 5: For saltwater use: build trap at low tide in location scouted at high tide.
Step 6: On rocky shores, use natural rock pools; on coral reefs, block pool openings as tide recedes.
Step 7: On sandy shores, use sandbars and enclosed ditches with low stone walls angled toward shore.
warnings: Entry hole must be sized for target fish - too large allows easy escape, too small prevents entry.
Position traps where fish naturally travel - schools move with tides and along shores.
Check local regulations regarding fish trapping in non-survival situations.
